meanings.definition: relating to or denoting individuals or strains that are genetically identical
meanings.sent1: The isogenic twins looked exactly alike.
meanings.sent2: The lab used isogenic mice for the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The isogenic flowers in the garden seemed to be playing a game of copycat.
meanings.sent4: The isogenic nature of the two cars made it hard to tell them apart.
meanings.sent5: The isogenic nature of the snowflakes made each one unique in its symmetry.

meanings.definition: a genetically identical individual or strain
meanings.sent1: The isogenic was a perfect match for the DNA sample.
meanings.sent2: The isogenic in the study group showed similar traits.
meanings.sent3: The isogenic in the pet store were like peas in a pod.
meanings.sent4: The isogenic of the bacteria made the research results more reliable.
meanings.sent5: The isogenic of the seeds ensured consistent growth patterns.
